lines.text: I'm in love with you.

[slaps him twice]
Snap out of it!

Loretta, I love you. Not like they told you love is, and I didn't know this either, but love don't make things nice - it ruins everything. It breaks your heart. It makes things a mess. We aren't here to make things perfect. The snowflakes are perfect. The stars are perfect. Not us. Not us! We are here to ruin ourselves and to break our hearts and love the wrong people and *die*. The storybooks are *bullshit*. Now I want you to come upstairs with me and *get* in my bed!
[Loretta accepts to marry Ronny instead of Ronny's brother Johnny, her ex-fiancé, in front of her family. Loretta's grandfather, the Old Man, starts to cry]
What's the matter, Pop?

[crying]
I'm confused!
In time you will see that this is the best thing.
In time you'll drop dead and I'll come to your funeral in a red dress!
Do you love him, Loretta?
Aw, ma, I love him awful.
Oh, God, that's too bad.

You're gonna marry my brother? Why you wanna sell your life short? Playing it safe is just about the most dangerous thing a woman like you could do. You waited for the right man the first time, why didn't you wait for the right man again?
He didn't come!
I'm here!
You're late!

[uncomfortable silence at kitchen table]
Someone, tell a joke...
Old man, you give those dogs another piece of my food and I'm gonna kick you 'til you're dead!

[after seeing La Boheme]
That was so awful.
Awful?
Beautiful... sad. She died!
Yes.
I was surprised... You know, I didn't really think she was gonna die. I knew she was sick.
She had TB.
I know! I mean, she was coughing her brains out, and still she had to keep singing!
You ruined my life.
That's impossible! It was ruined when I got here! *You* ruined *my* life!
[Loretta announces she's going to marry Johnny Camareri]
I don't like him.
You're not going to marry him, Cosmo. Do you love him, Loretta?
No.
Good.
[She looks at Cosmo]
When you love them they drive you crazy because they know they can.
How's the mother?
She's dying. But I could still hear her big mouth.

Everything seems like nothing to me now, 'cause I want you in my bed. I don't care if I burn in hell. I don't care if you burn in hell. The past and the future is a joke to me now. I see that they're nothing. I see they ain't here. The only thing that's here is you - and me.
You... you got a love bite on your neck. He's coming back this morning, what's the matter with you? You're life's going down the toilet! Cover up that damn thing! Come on, put some make-up on it!
You ruined my life!
No, I didn't.

Oh, yes, you did! Oh, yes, you did! Y'know, you got them bad eyes, like a gypsy, and I don't know why I didn't see it yesterday. Bad luck! That's what it is. Is that all I'm ever gonna have? I should have taken a rock and killed myself years ago!
You have someone on that plane?
Yeah, my fiancé.

[angry]
I put a curse on that plane. My sister is on that plane. I put a curse on that plane that it's gonna explode, burn on fire and fall into the sea. Fifty years ago, she stole a man from me. S'aprese il mio uomo! Today she tells me that she never loved him, that she took him to be strong on me. Now she's going back to Sicily. Ritorna in Sicilia! I cursed her that the green Atlantic water should swallow her up!
I don't believe in curses.

[shrugging]
Eh, neither do I.
Chrissy, over on the wall, bring me the big knife. I want to cut my throat.
Have I been a good wife?
Yeah.
I want you to stop seeing her.
[Cosmo rises, slams the table once, and sits down again]
Okay.

[pauses]
And go to confession.
I ain't no freakin' monument to justice! I lost my hand! I lost my bride! Johnny has his hand! Johnny has his bride! You want me to take my heartache, put it away and forget?
La bella luna! The moon brings the woman to the man. Capice?
Are you drunk?
No. Are YOU drunk?
No... but I have a hangover.
A bride without a head!
A wolf without a foot!
No, I think the house is empty. I can't invite you in because I'm married. Because I know who I am.
I just want you to know no matter what you do, you're gonna die, just like everybody else.
Thank you, Rose.
A man understands one day that his life is built on nothing, and that's a bad, crazy day.
Your life is not built on nothing! Ti amo.
I can't sleep any more. It's too much like death.
Bless me, Father, for I have sinned. It has been two months since my last confession.
What sins have you to confess?
Twice I took the name of the Lord in vain, once I slept with the brother of my fiancee, and once I bounced a check at the liquor store, but that was really an accident.
Then it's not a sin. But... what was that second thing you said, Loretta?
Why do men chase women?

Well, there's a Bible story... God... God took a rib from Adam and made Eve. Now maybe men chase women to get the rib back. When God took the rib, he left a big hole there, where there used to be something. And the women have that. Now maybe, just maybe, a man isn't complete as a man without a woman.

[frustrated]
But why would a man need more than one woman?
I don't know. Maybe because he fears death.
[Rose looks up, eyes wide, suspicions confirmed]
That's it! That's the reason!
I don't know...
No! That's it! Thank you! Thank you for answering my question!
Aw, Johnny, you're 42 years old and she's still runnin' your life!
You'll have your eyes opened for you, my friend.
I have my eyes open.
Oh yeah? Well, stick around. Don't go on any long trips.
I don't know what you mean.
I know you don't. That's the point. I'll say no more.
You haven't said anything!
And that's all I'm saying.
My mother has a saying. Do you want to hear it?
Sure.
Don't shit where you eat!
Would anyone like some oatmeal?
Yes, Mrs. Castorini, I would LOVE some oatmeal.
No, we don't want any oatmeal!
Nice to meet you.
[lifts back Ronny's collar]
. Got a love bite on your neck. Your mother's recovered from death.
Oh, great. We're not close, so I'm not really moved.

There are three kinds of pipe. There's what you have, which is garbage - and you can see where that's gotten you. There's bronze, which is pretty good, unless something goes wrong. And something always goes wrong. Then, there's copper, which is the only pipe I use. It costs money. It costs money because it saves money.

[about the hickey and the doorbell is ringing]
Put some make up on!, Cover up the damn thing, your life is going down the toilet! Answer the damn door!
[Cosmo is trying to wake up his wife Rose]
Rose. Rose. Rose! Rose!
[She wakes up]
Who's dead?
I'm getting married.
Again?
Yeah.
You did this once before, it didn't work out.
The guy died!

[after spending the night with Ronny]
I'm gonna marry him.
What?
Last night never happened, you hear me? I'm gonna marry him anyway and last night never happened, and you and I are gonna take this to our coffins!
I can't do that.
This is the most tormented man I have ever known. I'm in love with this man, but he doesn't know that, 'cause I never told him, 'cause he could never love anybody since he lost his hand and his girl.
Son of a bitch!
[he lifts Loretta into his arms]
Wait a minute! Where are you taking me?
To the bedroom.
I have no money.
You're as rich as Roosevelt. You're just cheap, Cosmo.
It looks stupid. It's a pinky ring. It's a man's ring!
It's temporary!
Everything is temporary! That don't excuse nothin'!
I looked the wrong way and I lost my hand. He could make you look the wrong way and you could lose your whole head!
[as Cosmo listens to "It Must Be Him" in the next room]
Now he's going to play that damn Vikki Carr record, and when he comes to bed he won't touch me.
Pardon me folks. That was just a very attractive mental patient.
Birds fly to the stars - I guess...
You have such a head for knowing!
This was painted by Marc Chagall. And, as you can see, he was a very great artist.
It's kind of little gaudy, don't you think?
Well, he was havin' some fun.
[Johnny, at his mother's deathbed, telephones his fiancee Loretta]
Did you tell her we're getting married?
I'm waiting... I'm waiting for a moment when she is peaceful.
Well, don't wait until she's dead.
They say bread is life. And I bake bread, bread, *bread*. And I sweat and shovel this stinkin' dough in and out of this hot hole in the wall, and I should be *so* happy! Huh, sweetie?
What am I going to tell him?
Tell him the truth. They find out anyway.
I have a feeling this is going to be just delicious.
We could go to my apartment. You could see how the other half lives.
I'm too old for you.
I'm too old for me; that's my predicament.
Now, Patricia, please don't leave!
So what do you think I am, some sort of talking dog?
I was just making a point about the way you said... the way you stated your aspirations.
Yeah? Well you can kiss my aspirations, Professor!
Kiss my aspirations? Oh, very clever! Yeah, the heighth of cleverness! Waiter!

[on the phone with Johnny]
Call me after you tell her... and uh, don't stand directly under the sun - you got a hat, use your hat.
Ok, I got my hat, all right.

[Bobo shows up with the dessert cart]
Would you like some dessert?

[looks at the cart]
You know I really shouldn't.
Will you marry me?
Bobo, take the cart away.
Veddy good, miss.
